Draft Rating:

C-

Jim Paxson ranks in the 42th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Paxson's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 4 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Carlos Boozer with 35th pick but was worth 2th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted DeSagana Diop with 8th pick but was worth 40th pick.
  • Drafted Dajuan Wagner with 6th pick but was worth 32th pick.
  • Drafted Trajan Langdon with 11th pick but was worth 23th pick.

Trade Rating:

F

Jim Paxson ranks in the 6th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Drew Gooden, Steven Hunter, Anderson Varejão to CLE.
  • Lost Tony Battie, Martynas Andriuškevičius, Brad Newley to ORL.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Chris Mihm to CLE.
  • Lost Jamal Crawford to CHI.

Signing Rating:

B-

Jim Paxson ranks in the 66th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:

  • Signed Kornél Dávid in 2000.
  • Signed Mark Hendrickson in 2000.
Their worst signings:

  • Signed Bimbo Coles in 2000.
